title: Darryl Roberts (American football)
text:
Darryl Keith Roberts (born November 26, 1990) is an <a href="American%20football">American football</a> <a href="cornerback">cornerback</a> for the <a href="Washington%20Football%20Team">Washington Football Team</a> of the <a href="National%20Football%20League">National Football League</a> (NFL). He played college football for <a href="Marshall%20Thundering%20Herd%20football">Marshall</a> and was drafted by the <a href="New%20England%20Patriots">New England Patriots</a> in the seventh round of the <a href="2015%20NFL%20Draft">2015 NFL Draft</a>. He has also been a member of the <a href="New%20York%20Jets">New York Jets</a> and <a href="Detroit%20Lions">Detroit Lions</a>.
Professional career.
New England Patriots.
The <a href="New%20England%20Patriots">New England Patriots</a> selected Roberts in the seventh round (247th overall) of the <a href="2015%20NFL%20Draft">2015 NFL Draft</a>. He signed his four-year rookie contract, worth 2.3 million, on May 8, 2015.
During training camp, Roberts competed to be a backup cornerback against <a href="Tarell%20Brown">Tarell Brown</a>, <a href="Robert%20McClain">Robert McClain</a>, <a href="Bradley%20Fletcher">Bradley Fletcher</a>, <a href="Justin%20Coleman">Justin Coleman</a>, and <a href="Leonard%20Johnson%20%28American%20football%29">Leonard Johnson</a>. On September 1, 2015, Roberts was placed on season-ending injured reserve after injuring his wrist in the first preseason game against the <a href="Green%20Bay%20Packers">Green Bay Packers</a>. Roberts was released on September 3, 2016.
New York Jets.
Roberts was claimed off waivers by the <a href="New%20York%20Jets">New York Jets</a> on September 4, 2016. In 2018, Roberts played in all 16 games with 10 starts, recording 48 combined tackles, seven passes defensed, and an interception. On March 14, 2019, Roberts signed a three-year, $18 million contract extension with the Jets. Roberts was released on March 21, 2020.
Detroit Lions.
On April 2, 2020, the <a href="Detroit%20Lions">Detroit Lions</a> signed Roberts to a one-year contract. He was placed on injured reserve on November 7, 2020, and was re-activated a month later.
Washington Football Team.
Roberts signed with the <a href="Washington%20Football%20Team">Washington Football Team</a> on March 26, 2021. He was placed on injured reserve on October 13, 2021, and returned to the active roster on December 2, 2021. On December 11, he was placed on COVID-19 reserve list and was activated again three days later.
